comment: As a guy myself,  I've ALSO been in an abusive relationship with a chick. Everything was always my fault and I was always wrong. Everytime she talked sh*t about me, it was because somehow I was a useless POS who never did anything right and I was always wrong and I was so terrible for it blah blah blah. I know what it's like to have a woman make you look like the bad guy when truly, you're the victim... I haven't dated in 3 years thanks to that BS experience that I was in for 5 FREAKING YEARS! What a waste of my time... I mean, yeah, sure, maybe I wasn't best guy, although I was her best since I was the nicest she's always told me... she always told me I was her best, but yet she'd scold me for no good reasons... although I will admit there were times where I was a BAD person in our relationship, but that wasn't OFTEN, I tried to be the good guy which 99 percent of the time, I was... but there were times where I was not, this is true... although my God was I treated like garbage. I never realized it until being broken up for a few months. She apologizes about how toxic she was even to this day and still tells me I was her best BF ever... so that's something... but still practically nothing. I don't trust women anymore hardly... comment: I love the pirates movies and Captain Jack. I have been an avid fan of Johnny Depp the man. I know by his actions in the public eye that this man is sincere and a man who takes care of his family and his partner or wife. Most "wife beaters" are obnoxious and flamboyant. If he were what they have labeled him, you would've heard of others that had same problems with him. More than likely abuse on his children. Has anybody heard of domestic  allegations being brought against him with anybody other than AH. Records that were brought out have proven that he has never been arrest for domestic abuse. With that being said, I would like to comment on the movies of his I have been watching on a regular basis. One is "Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street", I was absolutely amazed at the vocal this man has. Gorgeous voice. I do not believe there is any part he cannot do. "Mortdecai" is another good movie. So many he has done that are absolutely wonderful and it always fascinates me how he changes his characters so much that there are times you can't tell for sure if it is him or not. The character he plays in "Tusk", I had to watch it a second time to realize it was him. I guess what I am trying to say is, he is wonderful as Captain Jack, but this man has so much talent that he can make any movie as memorable as Captain Jack.
author: Barbara Morgan

comment: All people. Not just celebrities, sports stars, or politicians, should be held to the same standards. "Human Standards". People place to high of a stigma on others who are great at what they do, and forget that they are only human beings. Not super heroes. Nobody has the right or the power to take something away from someone else, simply because they do not like them or what they do. They do however, have the right not to watch them. Disney is wrong for what they did to JD. I can tell you, that I judge a person by their actions and who they are as a person. I may not agree with their lifestyle, but it doesn't make them a bad person. I can tell you that I will not watch any of the upcoming Pirates of the Caribbean without JD. I will also not watch any movies that promote the LGBTQ community or homosexuality. This is my choice. I don't agree with that lifestyle, and for that reason, I will make that choice. It isn't because I am Homophobic or a gay basher, it is simply because I don't agree with it. I treat all human beings with respect and I don't go thumping a bible on peoples foreheads, and I expect the same values to be reciprocated to me. The old but still viable saying is, "Do unto others as you would have them do unto you". Why can't we just treat all people with love and respect in this world. We can understand our differences and respect our personal boundaries at the same time. Love is more powerful, but hate is so much easier. Everyone should try to think with the head on their shoulders and act with their heart. The world would be a better place. Of course who am I? I am nobody to most, something to a few, and important only to a select few. Unless it is an election year.LMAFAO.

comment: I have to agree, I will not watch Pirates of the Caribbeans if ,Johnny Depp and Orlando Bloom are not in it! Also when you're in a relationship with another person sometimes you have those little altercation and some big ones .But that said people tend to blow them out of proportion ,so yes people can be wrong on both sides .But I also think they need to just go and drop it. They both have been sorely humiliated by one another and especially the negative media at this point . Therefore causing their hatred between each other ,increasing even more striking fear into each other battling to see who wins !  I think this is enough, move on let it go already! It is so sad how celebrities personal lives have to be thrown into the media while paraded around like a circus . I think issues like this should be in the courtroom and nowhere else ,without the medias right to invade on privacy ! All it does is demonize a person's real life character! Now a lot of women are finding the strength to come out about being abused and taking action against their abusers and that's a good thing take up for yourself I believe that 100% !   I'm the type of person though if I get into a altercation ,sure I will first try to come up with a peaceful solution . But if someone hits me I'll try to call the police for help ,but if they put their hands on me or try to physically hurt me I'm going to hurt them back really really bad that's just a fact. But in alot of cases men get accused for things they didn't even do,or small mistakes that get turned into a big lies making them look like monsters . Which is very wrong ,there's a lot of fake Karen's out there and they need to stop lying . Neither Johnny Depp or Amber Heard are perfect in the relationship status , their relationship was a disaster waiting to happen , but no one is perfect. I think when Amber went out to tell her story the media instantly latched on to it and turned into a f****** circus and then Amber's freaking out going oh my God I guess I have to go along with this and make myself look like I've been hurt harder than I actually was because ,I'm so scared that Johnny will win because  he is bigger in the industry than she is has more power and is more likable ! I don't know what she was thinking ,but I think she should have thought it out a little bit better than that . And no I wasn't there so I don't know what really happened ,but I don't think it was as big as it turned out to be .We all make mistakes we should all learn from our mistakes ,I have made mistakes and I'm trying my best not to make any more mistakes in my life. I just wish these two could come to a middle ground stop the bickering drop the case all together. I understand about the money she said she was supposed to give to a charity .I just think she should just give that money to the charity like she said ,but not any additional money. Money is so evil and fighting over it is not going to fix anything . She got caught in a lie and I think the humiliation of it all really was probably enough and I hope she can overcome it and find some warmth because I don't think she's as big of a  monster that everybody puts it ,she's human too and she's has some good in her too . I think they both need to apologize to each other for what ever reasons they feel . I hate that they got into the media like this nothing's good in the media, except for positivity so apologizing to each other in the media. Thats is the key to both of them to continue their success to go on to regain their credibility as great performers . And when it comes to Disney they had no choice, because they have to keep a good reputation. But come on Johnny Depp most likely has won his case and I think this should be over with already and Disney should allow him to be in the Pirates of the Caribbean because nobody's going to watch it if he's not in it !‚úåÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüòä

comment:
I am usually not one of these crazy fan boys but in this case I have to make an exception. Because it is just idiotic to not hire him again for captain Jack Sparrow. I mean yeah it is crazy how much these actors cost these days, just like Robert Downey Jr who got around 75 million just for avengers endgame, which was a terrible movie anyway, because we left him as Tony Stark.
And now rethink all that...wasnt it these two actors who made the movie franchises so totally awesome in the first place? It was their own acting paired with a few self made interpretations, wasn't it? It has a reason why that movies actually gained that much popularity, that much money on cinemas, home cinema and fan articles. I would say you better get this awesome and only real actor for captain Jack sparrow role back to business. If he wants of course. But I guess if he gets aware of the crazy fans like you and me who definitely want him back for the role. He might will.

And yeah that's a problem in this business. Because the actors are those who are actually to see in front of the camera. That means we love the movies not for the people who are working for it in the background, but in the camera light. We see the actors only.
And it's just not to change. So give him what he kind of deserves. I don't like money at all. So I don't care who have it, I care for those who haven't any.

comment:
I'm gonna be honest...hope Johnny decides himself not to reprise his role...not cause i think he's bad as Jack Sparrow (no other actor can surpass him as said character imo) but because i've come to despise Disney and refuse to watch/buy anything with their name attached. Johnny's better off finding producers/companies that will actually use his talents well without the horseshit attached to their names that Disney has nowadays.

Hell Johnny and other actors that are being treated like trash as well as Directors, makeup artists, cameramen, etc that are sick of what Hollywood has become should gather together to make their own Hollywood elsewhere (as far from CA/other "woke" cities as possible...hell center of the US would be idea if only cause it'd be more convenient to get there as it's right in the middle of the country). For the most part i'm sick of movies from Hollywood in general nowadays...only upcoming movie i remotely care about is Jurassic World 3 (and god knows when that's coming out...supposedly was supposed to be 2021 but that was before Covid) but besides that there's nothing really interesting that i can see...hell for the most part these past 5+ years i've mainly spent eithe reading books, watching Youtube videos or (subbed) anime, or playing games (generally jprgs) over watching anything Hollywood's put out. Hell even some news related articles/videos are more entertaining than some of the movies Disney's/companies like them have been putting out which pretty much shows how far the movie industry has fallen nowadays (and this isn't even an issue with wokeness btw, though it doesn't help, movies nowadays have been boring as hell with fairly lackluster stories and writing).

I'm glad to see that sensible people stood up to the BS and at least got Disney to see the light, if only because the fans have the purchasing power hahaha.  However, why they feel the need to placate a group by making a character LGBTQ is beyond me.  Why does everything nowadays have to have a little of everyone just because it's PC.  I don't see the need to have characters be a certain way just because the film industry wants to make it seem like they care.  This is why many movies and tv shows are so lame and utterly devoid of any substance due to the fact the characters are out of this world and don't make sense.  I miss the shows and movies of the 80's and before.  Those were real actors in real tv shows that not only entertained but also taught.  Today's junk teaches nothing except how to be WOKE and PC.

comment:
Whether by accident or design, Captain Jack Sparrow IS Pirates of the Caribbean. Think about it; what brought fans back time and time again - the other pirates...?, the lure of the sea...?, lush tropical movie sets...?, the lame plots?? NO. It was, and always will be CJS. Had the character been killed off in the first movie and people somehow still returned for the sequels, I'd say there could be hope to continue the series. But, that ship has sailed (pun intended) and Disney is now stuck on dry land.

Set aside the whole Amber-drama and every other excuse this video gives for dumping Depp for a moment. I'm not going to speculate what did or didn't happen between Heard and Depp or debate whether Depp is too expensive a dick to work with; for the point I'm trying to make, it's all irrelevant. What I'm saying is, for WHATEVER reason, NO CAPTAIN JACK SPARROW = a guaranteed loser at the box office... period.

Can you imagine Friday the 13th returning with a new killer instead of Jason, or another Nightmare on Elm Street without Freddy? F##K NO!! They'd go straight to video hell (the Walmart bargain bin)... alongside any "Pirates" movie without CJS.

comment:
Putting aside defamation which can be an arbitrary figure, because how can you put a $$$ value on reputation? The contracts he has lost on Pirates of the Caribbean and Fantastic Beasts ALONE are worth close to $100 million.
 When he is proven innocent, which is looking more and more likely, he will, rightfully, sue to recoup that money from the movie studios. The movie studios will then sue Amber Heard to recoup THEIR money.
 And I'm guessing she doesn't have those type of dollar dollar bills. 
Without the ability to pay that money which, again, is not an arbitrary figure but rather specific amounts according to legal contracts, the courts won't have many options other than to look at goal time, because $100 million (plus defamation $$$), is a SHITLOAD of community service.
Perjury is most likely what they'll charge her with

comment: In anger, my ex girfriend, whom I loved dearly, contacted relatives, friends, work, possible business partners, my school, mentioning all kinds of horrible accusations, unfortunately I did not have the money Depp has, and went through some of the roughest days of my life, to the point of almost commiting suicide, not retaliating, respecting the love that once was, hoping for good to prevail. I lost business opportunities, people I cared about stoped talking to me. Fortunately the people that trully loved me did not believe a single thing and they are still in my life. I was able to move on and it made me so much stronger that I could ever be. I know now that if she did it again I will not go out so quiet.  If you take an accusation right away to be the truth, either you are too young or really naive.

He who is without sin  cast the first stone.  Johnny Depp is a classy guy, a singular actor and a kind and generous human being. After all the years ge worked for you?  All his years in multiple marriages and children.  Violence to women  to anyone has a history.  It doesn't just manifest.  I didn't believe these allegations when I first heard them.  I am very happy that Johnny has been vindicated.  Your executives are morons.  You believed a twat like Amber Heard?  A do nothing gold digger?  I hope Johnny triples his payment ask for any films he does for Disney in the future.

comment:
I remember Will & Elizabeth was removed from the story, and the 4th movie somehow felt empty. I mean, it wasn‚Äôt bad and indeed Jack Sparrow was the key character, it‚Äôs just the movie felt so different as I was so used to those two as well. Then in 5th movie they were getting back to Turners and even tho Will was in the movie for several minutes, but Elizabeth was literally appearing for a brief moment, 5th part felt so much more going well with the first three parts, probably because of the story line which continued with Henry‚Äôs appearance, so, involved a bit of his parents as well. And they all again needed Jack Sparrow for some reason and it all nixed so well together with the other story parts!

Then again taking Jack/Johnny totally off the movie definitely would be wrong. Unless, they don‚Äôt want to start the movies all over again or do a spinoff. I‚Äôve heard about reboot, meanwhile, the postcredits scene in 5th movie made me think we‚Äôre not quite done with Will, Davy Jones, so, there must be some Jack in there as well. I do understand that Disney loves to cancel everyone with any kind of scandals, but they shouldn‚Äôt be so sharp with this unless it‚Äôs known to be a proved reality. Nobody knows what others do behind the closed door, and I‚Äôm quite sure there are some people who really should be taken off, but they still manage to do their stuff in peace. Disney also should understand that Depp has created pretty much iconic character. Nobody can do this instead of him or no character can replace Jack Sparrow. As I said earlier, the 4th part already felt so empty for me without Orlando Bloom and Keira Knightley, it was nearly different story, but it would be absolutely different story, if also Jack would be taken away.

As for Fantastic Beasts, there‚Äôs also significant character of Grindelwald. I personally can‚Äôt imagine any other person putting Grindelwald on the show. I remember how my best friend was absolutely on fire after watching the 2nd part of the movie and Johnny in it. Unlike her, I‚Äôve never been overly huge fan of Johnny specifically, but nobody can deny he‚Äôs a diamond among the rocks. Whatever role he takes, it almost everytime becomes something iconic. And it‚Äôs soooo visible Amber just makes the victim out of herself while the actual victim is Johnny! I didn‚Äôt even know about her existance before this came up. So, congratz, Amber, you will always be remembered as husband mocking and beating wife, who just tries to get money out of them in every possible way.

comment: What this all comes down to is a very critical matter and the reason is, we have come as a nation to respect and admire the equality of woman across the nation and show support and protect them against the harm and wrongdoing of mistreatment towards them in one way or another. Whenever there is an accusation made on their behalf you almost always want to believe them and blame the male because you sympathize how wrong it must have been for them to go through that and also want to show your support in bringing justice to the matter, but in this case it was not so. This was a major step back in some ways more than others for an accusation for or against a woman especially in the Hollywood films business. Aside from this story that shed light on wrong accusations that can and still exist of the poorly accused men today is the only positive to this story, Amber Heard greatly charged a bad rep for females in the near future that may go through the same thing and will be harder to get their story across in a believable manner. People will always look back at similar cases and compare them, something to fall back on and say ‚Äúwell remember the case where Amber Heard lied and blamed her husband and faked bruises and soars‚Äù it loses all credibility at that point. Luckily for the men in this case that are being honest finally stand a fair chance.

comment:
I have followed this case for some time now and have seen the court documents and the evidence presented. There is  no doubt in my mind at all that Amber Heard is not only the abuser in this case, but a blatant liar and shameless manipulator.
But no-one should take anyones word for that. Go and review the evidence and the facts of the case available and make up your own mind. 
It's so vitally important in this time of hearsay and media bias and dishonesty, to be able to access facts and evidence so you can determine their credibility for yourself.
The channels that I follow and  know to be covering this case in depth, going over evidence and court documents, are the following: 

Lost Beyond Pluto    (she is a lawyer and goes through the court documents and the case from a law perspective -very informative)
ThatUmbrellaGuy    (Great content, always directly backed by the latest evidence)
Stevie J Raw     (also absolutely excellent at going through the evidence and facts - has full readings of witness and defence statements)
Come Geek Some    (same, references and goes over facts and court documents)
Colonel Kurtz     (has very interesting in-depth content on the case from a more psychological/philosophical angle)

As mentioned, Stevie J Raw has uploaded FULL unedited readings of the court statements of Amber Heard, Johnny Depp and other important key persons in the case, giving you direct access to their own statements so you can compare and come up with your own opinion as to who is telling the truth.

comment: I'll never understand why anyone thinks a recast is a profitable option. No Depp, no pirates. if you do not want to employ him then stop making those movies, because without him you will not make as much money as you want. Regardless of what we think of this thing with Depp and his ex, a recast would just be a waste of money and time. Because that character is portrayed by one person for so incredibly long, the unintentional yet inevitable change in that particular character will not attract very many fans of the previous films. And the same thing goes for Grindelwald. Every actor has their own unique style, and no matter how hard that person might try to be like Johnny Depp, they aren't. That change will be noticed by the fans, and it probably will not receive good review.
